content.description: Crux is the first two moves, getting around the roof, after that it is a scramble.   Short problem near to the ground that could be a boulder problem except the ground slopes substantially and a fall could cause someone to roll quite a ways.   A much easier climb can be done just to the right.  See Butt Friction.
content.protection: Can be set up as a top rope with gear by building an anchor to the east of the bolts for stellar roof or led using gear in the crack the route travels along.
content.location: See image, route and belay station is to the right of stellar roof, up a short scramble.

content.description: The big roof to the right of Loading Bay bears some intersting huecos. They appear to be mud spattered and friable, but once you stick your mitt in them, they are sharp brown crystals that are relatively solid. Crank up on these to surmount the roof, where a short section of delicate face climbing gains the anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts for the top-rope anchor are eaily reached from the top. Gain the top by scrambling around the wall to the east and north until an easy boulder problem up chossy rock allows entrance to the top.

content.description: Climb the arete left of Steel Dihedral.
content.protection: Top-rope from Steel Dihedral bolts or less conveniently from easier to reach Loading Bay bolts.
content.location: Left of Steel Dihedral on Hybrid Wall

content.description: A highly aesthetic dihedral which catches your eye before any of the other routes on the Hybrid Wall. The rock is almost perfectly smooth throughout the climb. A few micro-edges help get you establsished in the dihedral, and then it's all smearing and bridging until you reach the headwall. The rock on the headwall is fairly crumbly.
content.protection: The anchors, 2 3/8" bolts appear to be in good condition. The thin seam is too small, and the rock is too fragile to lead this climb safely.
content.location: The anchors are somewhat awkward to reach from the top, as they are a few feet below the edge of the summit, which is also sloped downward. No rap-rings are present. Some people top-rope this climb from the Loading Bay anchors.

content.description:
The easier line just to the right of Steel Dihedral. The climbing is fairly interesting although short. The route tops out in a tiny notch. 

  Use caution as some of the holds appear loose.
content.protection: The 2-bolt anchor is right in the tiny notch, one bolt on either side. Two shoulder length slings are useful for setting up the top rope.

content.description: Crux is at the bottom, get up off the ground around a small overhang and then a slightly technical turn followed by an easy scramble.
content.protection: Can set up a top rope with gear by going around the top as if setting up the other routes on the wall or lead it on gear.
content.location: See images, to the right the other climbs is a crack in a bulge just right of the large overhanging roof which the left of is stellar roof.

content.description: This short and steep wall has three good established top-ropes as well as a short trad route. The route that stands out on this wall is Steel Dihedral, a beautiful and clean dihedral. The rock is pretty good down low, but some loose sections are still present so be careful and test holds before comitting your weight to them. The anchors are relatively easy to get to by scrambling uphill to the west.
